Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Beware!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: loveme2012
Reviews.Content: Scary is the only word that can be used to describe this place. I quite frankly didn't even get past the parking lot and entrance before deciding that I was not staying at this hotel. It was dark and dingy. The picture of the hotel on the website does not do it justice (it is much worse than that). . Do yourself a favor and spend the extra money and upgrade to a much better hotel. It was not close to any events or site-seeing (wells fargo center for concerts, liberty bell, downtown, etc..) . I guess the first hint should have been the "No Refunds" listed on their site. Most places will give you up until a certain time to cancel without cost to you. Quite frankly my safety and comfort are more important than the refund and chose to eat the cost (albeit I cancelled in the a.m.) Please do your research and check the reviews before reserving in this hotel so that you do not get into the mess I was in upon arrival. Thankfully I made it out alive and safe .. but you been warn!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Worst ever.”
Reviews.Author: cw120
Reviews.Content: All I can say is horrible not worth the money and we had to ask the front staff for an iron & ironing board they keep them at the front desk. The staff did not speak to us he just pointed for me to give him my credit card upon arrival. I should have known that the room would be bad because of how the hallway smelled (bad) then of course the room. Holes in the sheets, dirty floors the air condtioner was broke and it smelled nasty, long strands of hair in the shower and on the shower curtain (UGH) & thin hand towels instead of bath towels. We could hear the neighbors upstairs and the breakfast was horrible the best part of the hotel was ihop and walmart around the corner will never stay again..

Reviews.Title: “Car was broken in to - Everything taken”
Reviews.Author: JamieMarie
Reviews.Content: DO NOT stay at this hotel. This entire section of Philadelphia is dirty, and just run down. My husband and I stayed here because we were going to a concert at the Mann center and then leaving in the morning to drive to VA to pick up our son. The night 'seemed' uneventful. We went to our car at 7 am and EVERYTHING in it was missing. Our gps, phone, camera, garage door openers, kids game boy chargers, money from the glove box. It was all GONE! We left nothing in plain sight. Everything was tucked away in the glove box or the trunk. The glove box, the console, and the hatch were all open. I went to the hotel management for help, but they could have cared less. My care was parked right under a camera. The staff told me their manager would be in later and would call me. He never called! I called the police and by the time I was done speaking with them I felt like they were the ones that broke into my car. They didn't care. They told me they didn't even investigate car break ins. They gave me a report # for my insurance and moved along. Turns out because it was personal property that was stolen it falls under home owners insurance. I have a 1,000 deductible and the vaule of my stuff came to around 900. Needless to say I lost all my stuff. I will NEVER stay in this section of town again!

Reviews.Title: “Terror in Philadelphia”
Reviews.Author: motorcar1
Reviews.Content: This hotel/? is a the worst I ever came across, Days Inn are not doing themselves any favour by having their name over this place.$1.00 a night would be too dear.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, shady, but not bad”
Reviews.Author: tth217
Reviews.Content: Like others have stated the hotel IS located in a shady part of philadelphia. It is NOT reassuring to guests that every parking space has a sign that reminds them they are not responsible for stolen items. It also is not too reassuring that there IS a huge bullet proof glass that separates you from the clerks. I do have to say though that I did enjoy my stay there. Me and my friends books rooms there for the new years and we got there early to check in, I am glad we did. The first room we were told was our has a HORRIBLE vomit smell, like one that somebody got drunk and puked in. We walked in the room, and then walked out and requested a new room. The clerks and staff were very nice and immediatly gave us another room and showed it to us, and even asked if it was ok, and offered to show us other rooms if it was not satisfactory. The room was clean, and I have no complaints. Our room did have an alarm clock, and i beleive it is standard that all of the rooms have one. The heater worked well and did not smell, and the bathroom was clean however I did not use the shower. I also recommend this because the clerks were very nice. Me and my date were going to a party and were supposed to have printed out our tickets at home. I did but she did not, so after we realized this we asked the clerks if we could use the internet. The clerk took us into their break room/office and let us print out our ticket. They were very nice with the limited english they spoke (maybe it was their accents, but very nice and receptive). They also hired a night time security guard since there is nothing keeping random people from walking in and going into the hotel. All in all I recommend this place for business trips, but not pleasure or family outings. The hotel is also difficult to get to being that roosevelt blvd is a 8 lane strangely divided highway.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting, Nasty, Dirty - Avoid Avoid Avoid”
Reviews.Author: tsasinc
Reviews.Content: I am amazed that this hotel is allowed to carry a Days Inn brand. The signs in the parking lot remind you that your car may be damaged or broken into. Once at the front lobby we had to talk to the representative through BULLET PROOF GLASS - thicker than I have seen at a bank teller window. While cancelling my room reservation (because of the dirtyness and fear) and talking through the small holes in the bullet proof glass some guy walked in and yelled - " HEY, I need a room for 2 hours" then proceeded to the window next to us and booked the room. YEIKS ---trust me run from this unsafe hovel. Don't trust the pictures on their website

Reviews.Title: “Too basic”
Reviews.Author: StarrMom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Days Inn in a block of rooms reserved for me. I was not surprised at the quality of the hotel due to the location. However, I would not recommend it unless you have to stay there for some reason. It was extremely basic, with no alarm clock even. However, the shower worked very well and there were toiletries - shampoo, and soap. And they did have free Wi-Fi! I was not impressed in the cleanliness - there was thick dust on the top of the drapes, and I was not sure about the carpet. And the continental breakfast is certainly nothing to write home about - 2 kids of cold cereal, OJ, coffee, hot water, corn muffins, and wheat bread to toast. Thankfully, there is an IHOP right next to the hotel and a Dunkin Donuts within walking distance. And don't be alarmed by the plexiglass over the hotel reception desk!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: amjohn312
Reviews.Content: My book club and I stayed at this hotel from May 15, 2009 to May 17, 2009. The first rooms that we were sent to were horrible. In our room, a drawer was missing from the dresser. There was hair on the heating/AC unit and the bathroom was very unclean. The otheroom was horrible. It was also unclean. The toilet lid was broken, there was mildew on the shower curtains, the chair was broken, and the lamps were loose. After complaining, we were moved to slightly better rooms. We were given a great price via the Internet because there was an error with the pricing that was listed. However, we had to wait an hour before checking in because the front desk clerk did not want o honor the price. The location was okay because we were in walking distance to a WalMart store. I would not recommend this hotel to any individuals who requires the use of an elevator because this hotel does not have one.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING”
Reviews.Author: peearewhy
Reviews.Content: this hotel is terrible. it was a different hotel from the pictures on the website. terrible neighborhood we did not feel comfortable at all. the room was dirty there was ciggerette burns all over the room and the bed. the bathroom was dirty there was mold on the toilet seat. the price is cheap but i can see why because the hotel is really bad we booked online so we were charged for one day. but for my safety i took the loss of money and stayed somewhere else. i would not recomend this hotel to anyone in the world.

Reviews.Title: “nightmare, at days inn”
Reviews.Author: melorve08
Reviews.Content: the first you seen when you walked in was bullet proof glass, had a room at the end of a verry long dark hallway (not much light!!)the room was verry dirty, black mold on shower curtain, beer bottle caps & dirt covering carpets, other peoples hair on bed blankets,grossdid not even use them to sleep with!!!! i would not ever ever stay thereagain,looks like high crime area now I know why they say no refunds, because no one in there right mind would stay in such a filthy gross room, if your ever thinking of staying there for any reason trust me change your plans...............

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've ever stayed at (but cheap”
Reviews.Author: tbone12373
Reviews.Content: DON'T stay at this hotel. This is the worst hotel i've ever stayed at. I arrived later at night for a one night stay at the hotel. Throughout the night I heard a guy next store on his phone, with a girl and tv extremely loud. The room itself was pretty bad as well. There were almost no power outlets and an extension cord was the only one I could find that had the lamp and clock plugged into it. The bed itself had sheets that moved around all night. I forgot my razor and went to the front desk (which is protected by a bank teller type piece of glass) and they said they didn't stock any travel necessities and told me to go to walmart the next morning. Breakfast was also unimpressive. The milk for the cereal was frozen.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy adn Underrated”
Reviews.Author: FrankOrleans_MA
Reviews.Content: It is unfortunate that there are so many poor reviews of this hotel. My wife and I loved our stay. The staff were the salt of the earth and the coffee was nothing short of fantastic. After enjoying a few spirits at Regans, the neighborhood bar located nearby, we stole back to the hotel to relax. The veranda in the courtyard was enchanting and reminded me of a B&B we stayed at in the south of France. I will certainly be back during my next trip to Philly. See you then.

Reviews.Title: “watch out for the trannies”
Reviews.Author: trannyrus
Reviews.Content: oh my god.. did we go back to a 3rd world country.. what did I miss. This place is awful.. First the entrance. I did not recognize this place from the pictures. The pictures of this were nice. The real thing.. looks like the beginning of Blade the movie. next.. the bullet proof glass. I knew the pope wasn't Indian so I was in trouble. . then, the room.. Loved the headboard. Must be Ron Jeremy had an orgie here because the bed was in shambles. I think someone drove their cadillac over it 27 times.. I think I saw a gold tooth in the toilet. This place was horrid. oh.. and the breakfast. Either the eggs weren't done well or somebody was having too much fun in the kitchen. Never ever stay here.. you will have to get medieval on your rash with your brillow pad and a quart of bleach.. Stay away. far far away.

Reviews.Title: “It stinks”
Reviews.Author: ViajantePortoAlegre
Reviews.Content: We ended up there by mistake, we were looking for another Day's Inn in Philadelphia where we had a booking and were told at the reception that this was the only Days Inn in the whole city. We have nothing to add to the terrible reviews in this page - dangerous place, dirty, smelly, couldn't be worse. We were lucky to get out of there alive!

Reviews.Title: “bad experience”
Reviews.Author: tanga3
Reviews.Content: There wasn't anything good about this hotel. It was an overall bad experience with gross marks on the wall, stained floors, and a toilet that kept running. Let's not forget the bed that you could feel every spring going into your back and that didn't even have a fitted sheet on it, but instead some make-shift down sheet. I would not recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here !!”
Reviews.Author: IS_Nurse
Reviews.Content: We got stranded at the Philladelphia airport during an ice storm and this was the only place we could find that had available rooms. This hotel is just nasty and in a dangerous neighborhood. The desk clerks were behind bullet proof glass. This should have been our 1st hint that we should have went back to the airport and slept in chairs. The rooms are filthy, our door did not seat well so we worried about our safety. The bathroom was straight out of the 50's. Activity in the hall all night. No tell hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Located in a terrible neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaTravelbuddy
Reviews.Content: This was the worst place I've ever stayed in my life. I've stayed in a lot of Day's Inn that were clean, adequate rooms in a safe neighborhood. As we followed the directions we became apprehensive. When we entered the hotel lobby we knew we had made a mistake when we saw the "bullet proof glass"surrounding the front desk. With our arrival being 4th of July week we felt stuck knowing we could probably not find another room in town at 7 PM. We decided it was better to lock ourselves in a room there than to risk not finding a room elsewhere and having to spend the night in the car. I'll just say that after my one night stay here I'm not sure if I'll ever book Days Inn again! The carpet was soiled. The headboards that were supposed to be bolted to the wall was coming off. We checked out at first light assuming this would be the safest time of day to get out! Prostitutes were hanging around out front and coming in purchasing rooms. Definately not a place for a family!

Reviews.Title: “Should have slept in my car”
Reviews.Author: sugarplumsusie
Reviews.Content: Desperate times coupled with lack of internet access led me here on a spur of the moment trip to Philly. The places downtown were charging twice as much (and another $30 for parking). I should have stayed in my car. The bullet-proof glass was the first thing. The "option" of smoking vs. non-smoking was a joke. I'm only glad that I was in the throes of a cold and couldn't smell the smoke (or the other smells that others have listed here). The shower curtain, while new-looking, was already spotted with mold. The "sanitized for your protection" on the toilet bowl wasn't at all convincing. And the stain on the floor? Let's say I wasn't doing a good job in convincing myself it was "fruit punch." Especially since the stain continued on the comforter and looked eerily like arterial spurt. Okay, maybe I watch too much CSI. I wouldn't walk barefoot on the threadbare carpet though. The nice policeman who came by late at night was a comfort. Not sure if it was a part of his rounds or if he was there for a particular reason. The closed circuit tv and "no payphone here" should be enough to keep all the drug dealers and murders away, right? Oh, and the pictures on this website showing the hotel must have been taken from another Days Inn because there's absolutely no resemblance whatsoever to the crappy place I stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor quality”
Reviews.Author: cindyny2
Reviews.Content: The room was dirty, my blanket had a hole on it. The bathroom smelled bad.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth The Convenience”
Reviews.Author: Happy111102
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel because we felt it would be convienient to get to the airport in the morning before our trip to Florida and we were able to leave our car at the hotel and just take a shuttle to the airport. Well...we were highly disappointed and disgusted! First of all...our car was not in a safe hotel parking lot as we had thought. Instead, our SUV (and anyone else who was doing long term parking) had to park across the street in a lot that had not survelliance or security. When we got into the room it looked nice enough, however, when I looked in the bathroom, the tub was not very clean and there were dark hairs on the floor! Needless to say, we did not dare shower at the hotel. The beds we slept on were probably 60 years old, the pillows were as flat as could possible be, the two elevators were in MUCH NEED of some maitenance (we thought we'd be stuck in one as someone prior to us), and our room was directly over the dumpster and lucky us...it was garbage day. We heard the dear old garbage man arrive at 3:30 am to collect the garbage. So not only did we sleep poorly on the terrible beds and pillows, but when we did manage to get slightly comfy we were woken up by the garbage man. Also, beware of their directions to their hotel...they are not very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Just plain disgusting!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is THE most disgusting place I have ever stayed at in my life. Not only did the place stink..I had to put sheets on top of the comforter and sleep under my coat! The only people who should stay here are the ones that were there anyway...the local crack heads. I checked out at 7 in the morning and checked in down the road at the Doubletree. NEVER EVER EVER spend your money at this place...it is horrible!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: clbalo
Reviews.Content: Two words can be used to describe this so called "hotel" - DIRTY and OLD. I was also shocked to see bullet proof glass in the lobby surrounding the "check-in desk." To make matters worse, the first room that we were put in had a roach lying on the floor on a piece of paper and you could tell that the room had not been cleaned that day (it was approximately 6 pm by the time we checked in). Apparently the maid had accidentally signed off on that room as having been cleaned. In addition, the wallpaper was literally hanging off the walls in some places and by looking at the ceiling and walls in other spots you could tell that there had been previous water damage. We were switched to a different room. Not quite as bad as the first one but still very run down and dirty looking. Not a room that you'd feel comfortable about walking around with no shoes in. Our whole experience at this hotel can be described as TERRIBLE. I DO NOT recommend staying here and I think that the Days Inn Corporation needs to inspect this hotel. It gives Days Inn a bad name.

Reviews.Title: “Dangerous, Filthy, Pricy!”
Reviews.Author: AKert
Reviews.Content: When I asked a staffer of the pennsylvania welcome center at the interstate for the way to this Days Inn, he told me it's not "a good neighbourhood". And he was right. There may be more dangerous places in Philadelphia but not a lot. The hotel itself is run-down and filthy. The smoking room smelled like a pub 2 o'clock in the morning. The enamel in the tub was peeled off in large portions, the ceiling light was removed. At least the sheets and the bathroom (though damaged) looked clean. If they'd take 20 $, i'd say these places have to exist for the budget traveller . But 100$... that's insolent!

Reviews.Title: “revolting”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After having just returned from spending 103 nights on the road on a world trip, i had to comment about this hotel and this is the only 1 out of all to get a bad review. First thing you see is the bullet proof shield in reception which told you what sort of area you are in. On the wall behind the counter is a 5 sunburst rating, either they stole it from another hotel or the Days Inn inspectors have not visited in a long while. The uninterested staff on the front counter told us they served breakfast (which turned out to be packet pastries and orange cordial). The room was a smoking room (we requested non smoking, apparently none available). It smelt like it had been smoked in 24hours a day and never aired or cleaned. I was afraid to touch anything in case of catching something. We were fearful for our hire car as to whether it would still be there in the morning. After checking out I had to wash all my clothes as they stunk of cigarette smoke. Never ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Reception behind bullet proof glass says it all!”
Reviews.Author: edm_van
Reviews.Content: Did not expect to see hotel reception behind bullet-proof glass! rooms are old, small, bathroom ready to fall apart. 20 minute drive to city. Can't really think of anyting good about it except that it was easy locating it. Basically it's a cheap hotel which uses Days-inn name to charge double what it's worth.
